shortdesc.p: Remote lighting allows you to operate network-based home lighting through a remote control.
The remote control has components that allow you to program and operate the light bulbs on your lighting network.
You can network LED light bulbs together to operate wirelessly from a remote control.

topic.title: Maximum Number of Network Light Bulbs

shortdesc.p: Testing shows you should network no more than 250 light bulbs to maintain reliable performance.
Network lighting operates at a low level of networking power but can successfully connect at long distances because they can send information from light bulb to light bulb.

topic.title: Considerations for Planning Your Lighting Network

shortdesc.p: Before installing your network lighting, you should plan how you want your lighting network to behave.

topic.title: Programming Light Bulbs to Lighting Groups

shortdesc.p: You can program one or more light bulbs to a lighting group to operate that group with your remote control.

topic.title: Turning On/Off or Dimming a Lights

shortdesc.p: You can turn on, turn off, or dim a lighting group by pressing the group number button and then pressing the power button or the dimmer control.
The network lighting components have specific electronic and technical specifications.
Specifications describing the electronics and technology inside the remote control.
Specifications describing the electronics and technology inside the LED light bulb.
